revised_title: Carl Frederick Abel Pantin: A Life in Zoology and Natural History
tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of Carl Frederick Abel Pantin, a distinguished zoologist and natural historian. Born into a family with a history of scientific and technological interests, Pantin pursued his passion for nature and zoology, studying at Tonbridge School and later at Cambridge. He conducted pioneering research on amoeboid movement and osmotic regulation in marine organisms, contributing to the understanding of these processes. Throughout his career, Pantin inspired and influenced many students and colleagues with his dedication to science and his noble character.
